description:
Unemployed persons

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus
13231 Unemployment statistics based on the ILO concept


12211 Microcensus
===========

Definition:
Unemployed persons are people who do not have an employment
relationship and are searching for a job, regardless of
whether they are registered as unemployed with an employment
agency (job centre) or not. From this aspect, the concept of
unemployed persons is more comprehensive than that of
registered unemployed. In line with the employment status
concept, however, registered unemployed who are temporarily
in marginal employment are not counted as unemployed persons
but as persons in employment.


13231 Unemployment statistics based on the ILO concept
================================================

Definition:
According to the labour force concept established by the
International Labour Organization (ILO) and concretised by
the EU, any person not economically active and aged between
15 and 74 years is considered unemployed if he or she
actively sought work over the four weeks preceding the
survey and would be available for starting a job
immediately, that is, within two weeks. It is irrelevant
whether the person is registered as unemployed with an
employment agency.
